column1: For attorneys general and insurance commissioners, only elected officials' political party is displayed.
*Governor Political Affiliation*: [Current Governors 2025](https://www.nga.org/governors-2/), National Governors Association (NGA), accessed June 24, 2025.

*State & Legislative Partisan Composition*: [NCSL State Elections 2024](https://www.ncsl.org/resources/ncsl-state-elections-2024), National Conference of State Legislatures (NCSL), Updated December 16, 2024.

*State Attorney General Political Affiliation*: [Attorneys General: Who's My AG?](http://naag.org/naag/attorneys-general/whos-my-ag.php), National Association of Attorneys General (NAAG), accessed June 24, 2025.

*State Insurance Commissioner Political Affiliation*: [National Association of Insurance Commissioners Membership List](https://content.naic.org/sites/default/files/regulator-membership-list.pdf), National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC), revised June 23, 2025.
1. The District of Columbia (DC) has an elected Mayor. Additionally, the legislative branch of DC is a 13 member City Council. The Council has a Democratic majority.
2. Nebraska has a Unicameral system with no political affiliations.
